### symbol

``` python

def symbol(
    icons, # icon dict
    nm, # Name of icon in lucide
    pre:str='', # Prefix to add to element id
):

```

*Create a
[`symbol`](https://AnswerDotAI.github.io/fastlucide/core.html#symbol)
element for an icon*

``` python
symbol(icons, nm, 'l-')
```

``` html
<symbol id="l-a-arrow-down"><path d="M3.5 13h6"></path><path d="m2 16 4.5-9 4.5 9"></path><path d="M18 7v9"></path><path d="m14 12 4 4 4-4"></path></symbol>
```

### sprites

``` python

def sprites(
    icons, # icon dict
    nms, # List of lucide icon names
    pre:str='', # Prefix to add to all element ids
):

```

*SVG element containing all symbols in `nms`*

``` python
sps = sprites(icons, [nm, 'accessibility'], 'l-')
show(sps)
```

### Icon

``` python

def Icon(
    nm, # Name of icon in lucide
    pre:str='', # Prefix to add to element id
    cls:str='lucide-icon', # class to use for svg
    vbox:int=24, # viewBox size (int for square, or (w,h) tuple)
    sz:int=24, # size of svg
    stroke:NoneType=None, # Stroke CSS
    stroke_width:NoneType=None, # Stroke width CSS
    fill:NoneType=None, # Fill CSS
    trans:NoneType=None, # SVG transform attribute
    attrs:VAR_KEYWORD
):

```

*A `use` element in an `svg` element refering to `nm`*

``` python
accs = Icon('accessibility', 'l-', sz=16)
accs
```

``` html
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="16px" width="16px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-accessibility"></use></svg>
```

``` python
print(accs(foo='bar'))
```

    <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="16px" width="16px" class="lucide-icon" foo="bar"><use href="#l-accessibility"></use></svg>

``` python
show(accs)
```

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="16px" width="16px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-accessibility"></use></svg>

``` python
show(Icon('accessibility', 'l-', sz=16, stroke_width=3))
```

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="16px" width="16px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-accessibility" style="stroke-width: 3"></use></svg>

## Transforms

Now let’s add a helper function to transform Icon’s with python object
methods.

Using that we can define [the six svg
transforms](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Reference/Attribute/transform#transform_functions)
as python instance methods.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/AnswerDotAI/fastlucide/blob/main/fastlucide/core.py#L97"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### Icon.rotate

``` python

def rotate(
    a, cx:int=0, cy:int=0
):

```

*Rotates the element by a degrees, optionally around point (cx, cy).*

``` python
show(au:=Icon('arrow-up','l-'))
show(au.rotate(45,12,12))
```

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-arrow-up"></use></svg>

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-arrow-up" transform="rotate(45,12,12)"></use></svg>

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/AnswerDotAI/fastlucide/blob/main/fastlucide/core.py#L103"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### Icon.scale

``` python

def scale(
    x, y:int=0
):

```

*Scales the element by x (and optionally y).*

Now we can also demonstrate transform chaining:

``` python
show(au)
show(au.scale(0.75,0.75))
show(au.scale(0.75,0.75).rotate(45,12,12))
```

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-arrow-up"></use></svg>

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-arrow-up" transform="scale(0.75,0.75)"></use></svg>

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-arrow-up" transform="scale(0.75,0.75) rotate(45,12,12)"></use></svg>

Continuing with the other transforms:

### Icon.translate

``` python

def translate(
    x, y:int=0
):

```

*Moves the element by x horizontally and optionally y vertically.*

``` python
show(au)
show(au.translate(-5,-5))
```

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-arrow-up"></use></svg>

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-arrow-up" transform="translate(-5,-5)"></use></svg>

### Icon.skewY

``` python

def skewY(
    a
):

```

*Skews the element along the Y axis by a degrees.*

------------------------------------------------------------------------

### Icon.skewX

``` python

def skewX(
    a
):

```

*Skews the element along the X axis by a degrees.*

``` python
show(au)
show(au.skewX(20))
show(au.skewY(20))
```

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-arrow-up"></use></svg>

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-arrow-up" transform="skewX(20)"></use></svg>

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-arrow-up" transform="skewY(20)"></use></svg>

The `matrix(a, b, c, d, e, f)` transform combines all other transforms
into one. The parameters map to:

- `a`, `d` — scale X and Y
- `b`, `c` — skew Y and X  
- `e`, `f` — translate X and Y

Common patterns: - `matrix(1, 0, 0, 1, tx, ty)` — translate by (tx,
ty) - `matrix(sx, 0, 0, sy, 0, 0)` — scale by (sx, sy) -
`matrix(1, tan(ay), tan(ax), 1, 0, 0)` — skew by angles ax, ay

For more details see [MDN SVG matrix transform
docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Reference/Attribute/transform#matrix).

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/AnswerDotAI/fastlucide/blob/main/fastlucide/core.py#L126"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### Icon.matrix

``` python

def matrix(
    a, b, c, d, e, f
):

```

*Applies a matrix transformation with 6 values.*

Examples showing their equivalence to the other transforms:

``` python
show(au.translate(5, 5))
show(au.matrix(1, 0, 0, 1, 5, 5))
```

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-arrow-up" transform="translate(5,5)"></use></svg>

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-arrow-up" transform="matrix(1,0,0,1,5,5)"></use></svg>

``` python
show(au.scale(0.7, 0.7))
show(au.matrix(0.7, 0, 0, 0.7, 0, 0))
```

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-arrow-up" transform="scale(0.7,0.7)"></use></svg>

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-arrow-up" transform="matrix(0.7,0,0,0.7,0,0)"></use></svg>

``` python
show(au.skewX(20))
show(au.matrix(1, 0, math.tan(math.radians(20)), 1, 0, 0))
```

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-arrow-up" transform="skewX(20)"></use></svg>

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-arrow-up" transform="matrix(1,0,0.36397023426620234,1,0,0)"></use></svg>

### Icon.\_\_iadd\_\_

``` python

def __iadd__(
    b
):

```

``` python
ad = Icon('a-arrow-down', 'l-')
show(accs+ad)
```

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="16px" width="16px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-accessibility"></use><use href="#l-a-arrow-down"></use></svg>

``` python
sps = sprites(icons, [nm, 'accessibility', 'check', 'user', 'plus', 'circle', 'file', 'arrow-up'], 'l-')
show(sps)
```

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" style="display: none"><defs><symbol id="l-a-arrow-down"><path d="M3.5 13h6"></path><path d="m2 16 4.5-9 4.5 9"></path><path d="M18 7v9"></path><path d="m14 12 4 4 4-4"></path></symbol><symbol id="l-accessibility"><circle cx="16" cy="4" r="1"></circle><path d="m18 19 1-7-6 1"></path><path d="m5 8 3-3 5.5 3-2.36 3.5"></path><path d="M4.24 14.5a5 5 0 0 0 6.88 6"></path><path d="M13.76 17.5a5 5 0 0 0-6.88-6"></path></symbol><symbol id="l-check"><path d="M20 6 9 17l-5-5"></path></symbol><symbol id="l-user"><path d="M19 21v-2a4 4 0 0 0-4-4H9a4 4 0 0 0-4 4v2"></path><circle cx="12" cy="7" r="4"></circle></symbol><symbol id="l-plus"><path d="M5 12h14"></path><path d="M12 5v14"></path></symbol><symbol id="l-circle"><circle cx="12" cy="12" r="10"></circle></symbol><symbol id="l-file"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></symbol><symbol id="l-arrow-up"><path d="m5 12 7-7 7 7"></path><path d="M12 19V5"></path></symbol></defs></svg>

``` python
show(Icon('circle', 'l-', sz=24) + Icon('check', 'l-', stroke='red'))
```

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-circle"></use><use href="#l-check" style="stroke: red"></use></svg>

``` python
show(Icon('circle', 'l-', sz=24) + Icon('check', 'l-', stroke='red').translate(2,3).scale(0.8))
```

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-circle"></use><use href="#l-check" style="stroke: red" transform="translate(2,3) scale(0.8)"></use></svg>

``` python
show(Icon('user', 'l-', sz=24, stroke_width=1).translate(-4, 0) +
     Icon('plus', 'l-', stroke_width=3).translate(9, 3).scale(0.6))
```

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-user" style="stroke-width: 1" transform="translate(-4)"></use><use href="#l-plus" style="stroke-width: 3" transform="translate(9,3) scale(0.6)"></use></svg>

``` python
show(Icon('file', 'l-', sz=24, fill='yellow') + 
     Icon('arrow-up', 'l-').translate(2,3).scale(0.7))
```

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-file" style="fill: yellow"></use><use href="#l-arrow-up" transform="translate(2,3) scale(0.7)"></use></svg>

Finally, lets show we can also apply transforms to combined icons by
adding a skewX to the last icon:

``` python
show((Icon('file', 'l-', sz=24, fill='yellow') + 
      Icon('arrow-up', 'l-').translate(2,3).scale(0.7)).skewX(10))
```

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="24px" width="24px" class="lucide-icon"><use href="#l-file" style="fill: yellow" transform="skewX(10)"></use><use href="#l-arrow-up" transform="translate(2,3) scale(0.7) skewX(10)"></use></svg>

### SvgSprites

``` python

def SvgSprites(
    pre:str='', vbox:int=24, sz:int=24, cls:str='lucide-icon', nms:tuple=(), attrs:VAR_KEYWORD
):

```

*Create and track used icons*

``` python
ss = SvgSprites('lc-', sz=18)
ss(nm)
```

``` html
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="18px" width="18px" class="lucide-icon "><use href="#lc-a-arrow-down"></use></svg>
```

``` python
show(ss('a-arrow-down'))
show(ss('accessibility', stroke_width=3))
show(ss)
```

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="18px" width="18px" class="lucide-icon "><use href="#lc-a-arrow-down"></use></svg>

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewbox="0 0 24 24" height="18px" width="18px" class="lucide-icon "><use href="#lc-accessibility" style="stroke-width: 3"></use></svg>

<style>.lucide-icon { stroke: currentColor; fill: none; stroke-width: 2; stroke-linecap: round; stroke-linejoin: round; }</style>

``` python
show(Style('.hover-bg:hover { background-color: aliceblue; }'))

```
